titles.title: Divisional Realignment Act of 2012
Divisional Realignment Act of 2012
Divisional Realignment Act of 2012
Divisional Realignment Act of 2012
Divisional Realignment Act of 2012
To amend title 28, United States Code, to realign divisions within two judicial districts.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 112-497.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 350.

action.text: Mr. Coble moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5512.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary:
10/5/2012--Public Law. (This measure has not been amended since it was passed by the House on May 30, 2012. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Divisional Realignment Act of 2012 - Amends the federal judicial code to realign counties comprising judicial divisions within the Eastern District of Missouri and the Northern District of Mississippi.
Makes this Act effective 60 days after enactment.
